articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Pushing Authorities' Talks to Rupture
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Pushing Authorities' Talks to Rupture
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The chief delegate of the south side to the first round of the north-south authorities' talks at a press conference in the Kaesong Industrial Park right after the rupture of the talks on Dec. 12 said the south approached the negotiations with sincerity after advancing various proposals but the north side created difficulties in the way of the talks by calling for the simultaneous solution of the resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang and the issue of "separated families".
					 The south Korean authorities even let conservative media float story that the "north was only concerned for the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang, money box", malignantly slandering the north and giving impression that it was to blame for the rupture of the talks.
					
					 A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a statement on Tuesday branded this as an intolerable and serious provocation against the dialogue partner.
					
					 The talks that were provided with much effort amid expectation and concern of all the Koreans ended without any fruit. This was an inevitable result of the confrontation policy of the south Korean authorities who are interested in neither genuine dialogue nor the improvement of the relations, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 In fact, we were of the view that things can hardly be settled even though we sit face to face with the south Korean authorities who are keen on the moves for escalating confrontation in total breach of the August agreement.
					
					 But the south side earnestly called for the authorities' talks, saying any issue can be discussed once they are opened. Our idea was to trust them and sit with them first and then solve issues that are deemed urgent and easy in the bilateral relations.
					
					 So, we, stressing the need to create the atmosphere of dialogue for improving the bilateral relations, proposed resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang and settling the issue of separated families and relatives, urgent issues about which all the Koreans are concerned, and reactivating exchanges in various fields.
					
					 But the south side raised lots of unimportant issues which are not helpful to the improvement of the north-south relations in wanton violation of the agreement made at the technical contact for the authorities' talks on seeking negotiated settlement of pending issues between the north and the south, thus deliberately creating difficulties and obstacles.
					
					 The DPRK side proposed simultaneously pushing forward and implementing the issues of the resumption of tour and the separated families and relatives as the south side shunned the discussion of the resumption issue but the south side flatly turned down discussion of the tour issue, saying that "it is principle not to link the issue".
					
					 We even allowed the extension of the talks, persuading the south side and showing magnanimity, but the south side insisted that it can never agree on resuming the tour, thus pushing the talks into a rupture.
					
					 What's more, the south Korean authorities now talk loudly in public that it proposed the issue of "three channels". It had better look back  on whether it has face to talk about "channel" as it blocked all the wide avenues that were created in the June 15 era and now goes mischievous not to open even such small channel as tour.
					
					 The talks clearly proved that as long as the south Korean authorities persist in dependence on outsiders and moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen, the north-south relations can never make even a step forward and that even though dialogue is held, nothing will be settled.

articles.title: Korean People Encourage African People: Kenyan President
articles.content:
Korean People Encourage African People: Kenyan President
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Myong Kyong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Kenya, presented his credentials to Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta on Dec. 8.
					 The president said that the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by extending disinterested support to the African people in the days when they suffered the most serious difficulties are kept deep in the hearts of the people in the region.
					
					 He noted:
					
					 The strong Korean people advancing along the straight road for the cause chosen by themselves after making their own decision are encouraging the African people.
					
					 The government and people of Kenya hope that the north and south Korea would be reunified in a peaceful way to achieve the prosperity of the entire nation at an early date.
					
					 He wished the Korean people greater success in their cause under the guidance of the supreme leadership in the future, too.

articles.title: SPA Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
SPA Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly led by Vice-Chairman An Tong Chun came back home Tuesday after taking part in the Eighth Plenary Session of the Asian Parliamentary Assembly held in Cambodia.

articles.title: DWUK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DWUK Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) headed by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, returned home on Tuesday after taking part in a meeting of the Executive Committee of the Women's International Democratic Federation held in Cuba and visiting Peru.

articles.title: DPRK Red Cross Society Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Society Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Executive Vice-Chairman Paek Yong Ho returned home Tuesday after taking part in the international red cross meeting held in Geneva.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here Tuesday laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK's History of Self-reliant Defence Industry
articles.content:
DPRK's History of Self-reliant Defence Industry
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The history of the DPRK's self-reliant defence industry tells about the undying feats performed by the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					 After Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule, President Kim Il Sung attached top priority to building the nation's self-reliant defence industry.
					
					 Early in October Juche 34 (1945), a few days before the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Il Sung toured the Phyongchon Plain in Pyongyang to choose a site for the country's first arsenal, which is now turned into the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site.
					
					 Since then, he had frequented the site to develop it into an all-round weaponry production base. When visiting the base in December 1948 to test-fire a submachine gun produced by its workers with their own efforts, he praised their spirit of self-reliance, stressing that what is important is to do anything by their own efforts.
					
					 True to the far-reaching plan of the President, Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, called at this arsenal 20-odd times to solve the problems arising in the production of submachine guns with domestic technology and materials.
					
					 Such energetic guidance of the great persons resulted in a rapid development of the national defence industry.
					
					 To glorify the President's great feats for building the self-reliant defence industry with credit, leader Kim Jong Il set forth the unique Songun (military-first) idea and line and had worked hard to carry them into practice.
					
					 Visiting the remodeled Phyongchon Revolutionary Site some days ago, supreme leader Kim Jong Un said that the site is home to the Songun arms and that the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to provide the eternal foundations for the country's self-reliant defence industry will shine for all ages.

articles.title: Great Devotion for People's Wellbeing
articles.content:
Great Devotion for People's Wellbeing
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- With the approach of the fourth anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il (Dec.17), all people in the DPRK recall with deep emotion the undying feats he performed for the prosperity of the country and wellbeing of people.
					In his lifetime, he visited more than 14,290 units across the country, covering the distance of 670,000 kilometers.
					
					 On March 20, Juche 85 (1996), he drove a car over 400 kilometers for the inspection of the eastern frontline units of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					
					Since he inspected the Tabaksol (young pine trees) Post of the KPA on January 1, Juche 84 (1995), he made a long journey for Songun leadership covering more than 353,576 kilometers till the last moments of his life.
					
					For the last three years of his great life, he gave field guidance to nearly 1,000 units.
					
					 He continued his inspection of many military and civilian units till he died in a train on the journey of field guidance on December 17, 2011. On the first Sunday of this month, he visited the Amusement Park in Kaeson Youth Park and the Hana Musical Information Centre and Kwangbok Area Supermarket on the 15th.

articles.title: Working People in DPRK Meet to Renew Their Pledge
articles.content:
Working People in DPRK Meet to Renew Their Pledge
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Workers and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and agricultural workers and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea separately held meetings at the Mansudae Art Studio and at the Maengjung Co-op Farm in Pakchon County on Tuesday to renew their pledge on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The participants in the meeting of workers and members of the federation laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the art studio and paid tribute to them. 
					
					 The attendants of the meetings renewed pledge to work hard to win the final victory in the drive for building a thriving socialist nation, single-mindedly united around Marshal Kim Jong Un, bearing deep the behests of Kim Jong Il in minds. 
					
					 Speakers said Kim Jong Il was the great revolutionary and peerless patriot who devoted himself to the country and its people all his life. 
					
					 They expressed the resolution to dynamically hasten the advance in the new century of Juche and accomplish the Juche revolutionary cause, Songun revolutionary cause, holding aloft the banner of great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Remembrance Concert Given by Youth and Students
articles.content:
Remembrance Concert Given by Youth and Students
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A concert "We'll Travel One Road Forever" was given by youth and students at the Central Youth Hall on Tuesday to commemorate the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The concert started with a narration and chorus "Oh, We Long for You." Put on the stage were numbers such as narration and female quintet "Snow-covered Old Home" and Janggu solo "General on a Galloping White Horse".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il who trained the Korean youth into warriors in the struggle for carrying forward and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 They lauded Marshal Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the tradition of victory of the Juche-oriented movement of the Korean youth established by the great leaders in such numbers story-telling and song presented by members of the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station "Yearning Is My Happiness" and male solo "Loving Care for Protecting My Destiny."
					
					 The concert ended with poems and choruses "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu", "We'll Travel One Road Forever" and "The General Will Live Forever As the Sun" reflecting the firm faith and will of five million youth and students to invariably make long journeys of revolution under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, holding Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the sun of Juche forever.

articles.title: U.S. Disqualified to Talk about Human Rights: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Disqualified to Talk about Human Rights: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is behaving like an "international judge of human rights," groundlessly pulling up other countries over their "human rights issues" in the world arena. 
					 Rodong Sinmun on Tuesday says this in an article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the U.S. where the racial discrimination has become the most serious issue in the world, though it advocates "equality for all".
					
					 The U.S. instituted the "Civil Rights Act" in 1964, which "grants" the black people the equal right with the whites in an attempt to calm down the fierce movement of the black people for civil rights in America. But the white people's discrimination against the black people doesn't stop.
					
					 More than ten thousand people fall victim to the gun-related crimes on an annual basis.
					
					 It is the reality of the U.S. that the popular masses who account for 99 percent of the population are subject to a miserable life and finally they are degenerated under the pressure of moneyed quarters who hold just 1 percent of it.
					
					 Lots of people are wandering the streets in quest of jobs in the U.S.
					
					 They are implicated in murder, robbery, alcoholism, drug abuse and suicide, ubiquitous social phenomena in the U.S.
					
					 All these evils unabated in the American society are increasing as a chronic cancer and driving the U.S. to the edge of explosion and division.
					
					 Nevertheless the U.S. doesn't feel ashamed and is making a litany of nonsense. The U.S. is disqualified to talk about the "human rights issues" of the other countries.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Military Authorities' Deliberate Military Provocation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Military Authorities' Deliberate Military Provocation
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military made public a plan for developing stealth drone tactical striking system aimed to mount a preemptive attack on major military targets of the DPRK on Dec. 6.
					 The warmongers asserted that this is a weapon system to strike the north's long-range artillery pieces and mobile missile launching ramp from high altitude by using drones. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is no more than a deliberate military provocation to round off the north-targeted attack posture while deliberately getting on the nerves of the DPRK and bringing the situation to an unstable phase.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers' moves to develop the stealth drone tactical striking system go to clearly prove that they do not want stable situation on the Korean Peninsula and their sinister intention is to escalate tension and mount a preemptive attack on the north.
					
					 Whenever an opportunity of dialogue was provided between the north and the south, they are working hard to becloud the atmosphere with their chronic evil practices and malignant intention.
					
					 Expectation and concern of all Koreans for dialogue and improved inter-Korean relations are growing stronger than ever before. Therefore, it is reckless for the south Korean authorities to make desperate efforts to bring the situation on the peninsula to an acute phase.
					
					 As long as there exist the politically-motivated military provocations to do harm to compatriots in collusion with outside forces in south Korea, it is impossible to defuse distrust and confrontation between the north and the south and to pave the way for improving the relations.
					
					 The south Korean military forces should cool their heads heated with war hysteria and stop running riot.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces Japan's Moves for Revival of Militarism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces Japan's Moves for Revival of Militarism
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The ruling Liberal Democratic Party of Japan shortly ago set up the history verification committee under the pretext of verifying the contemporary and modern history of Japan. The body that put up the signboard of "headquarters learning history and thinking of the future" will reportedly deal with history ranging from the start of the Sino-Japanese War in 1894, the defeat of Japan in the Second World War and to postwar settlement of Japan.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary says the setting up of the committee is aimed to grossly distort the truth of history and academically justify the past crimes.
					
					 Japan is putting spurs to turning itself into a military giant, eyeing revenge for its defeat, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is capable of manufacturing nuclear weapons as it pleases any time and has in place even their delivery means. It is also pressing for military advance into space.
					
					 Now Japan can launch reinvasion any moment. It has rounded off all the preparations for overseas advance.
					
					 But Japan should clearly understand the law of history and the truth that aggressors have no justice and injustice is bound to fail.
					
					 The repetition of the past crimes will lead to a final ruin.
					
					 The only way for Japan to exist is to abandon its ambition for reinvasion.

articles.title: Space Is Not Monopoly of U.S.: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Space Is Not Monopoly of U.S.: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- It is stipulated in the "provisions for the competition in commercial space rocket launches" ratified by U.S. President Obama on Nov. 25 that the Departments of Transport and Defense of the Administration as well as the NASA have the right to decide what should be put into space, what should be brought and what is allowed to bring to the land. This means any country should get prior approval from the U.S. regarding space exploration and development.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says the U.S.-style arrogance and self-complacency have gone beyond the tolerance limit to reach the stage where it lords it over the world in disregard of international law and practices.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Space is not a monopoly of someone but a property common to humankind and this is guaranteed by international law.
					
					 The U.S. is keeping itself busy, trumpeting about adopting a new domestic act on space development. This reflects, in essence, its ambition to become "space gendarme".
					
					 It is the U.S. ambition to monopolize space, study and develop space-related technology and meet its own interests.
					
					 In recent years the U.S. branded the DPRK's space development for peaceful purpose as "missile development" while egging its followers on to put "international pressure" on it in a bid to meet the above-said purposes.
					
					 The U.S. fabrication of domestic act does not mean space will belong to the U.S.
					
					 Vast space has no border and space will remain common property of humankind forever.
					
					 The DPRK will exercise its right to space development with dignity no matter what the U.S. may say about it.
					
					 The U.S. has to stop encroaching upon sovereignty by finding fault with the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Anti-DPRK Confab in S. Korea
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Anti-DPRK Confab in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- There took place a "disarmament, non-proliferation meeting" jointly sponsored by the UN and the south Korean Foreign Ministry in Seoul recently.
					 Minju Joson in a commentary Tuesday says the meeting disguised as a UN meeting was an anti-DPRK confab of the south Korean present conservative ruling forces and the dishonest hostile forces who seek to force the DPRK to lay down its arms and realize the ambition of "unification of social systems" and "unification through absorption" in collusion with outsiders.
					
					 The recent trumpeting at the confab is not just rubbish of conservative elements but reflects the sinister intention of the south Korean authorities, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 By origin, south Korea is not fit for discussing disarmament and nuclear non-proliferation.
					
					 It is a tragicomedy that "disarmament and non-proliferation meeting" was convened in such a place to discuss someone's nuclear issue.
					
					 As recognized by the public at home and abroad, disarmament and the nuclear non-proliferation are important issues directly related to global peace.
					
					 Therefore, the meeting should be hosted by responsible countries and focus on arbitrary practices of the U.S. which tops world's list in military spending and stockpiles lots of nuclear weapons.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the UN is being played into the hands of those imbeciles who make far-fetched assertions making profound confusing of right and wrong, forgetful of its basic mission to preserve global peace and security.
					
					 Such attitude of sitting on the fence as conniving at the acts of the U.S. and its followers keen to lord it over the world will leave a shameful page in UN history and this will only deteriorate the situation on the Korean Peninsula and the region, far from helping achieve peace and stability.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Denounced for Her Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Denounced for Her Reckless Remarks
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive on Dec. 8 expressed anger at the fact that various evil bills such the bill on retrogressively revising the labor law, bill on economy and bill on counter-terrorism were not cleared and accused opposition parties, using such senseless words as "agents of the group with vested right".
					 On the previous day she called heavyweights of the "Saenuri Party" to Chongwadae and ordered them to clear the bills in strong terms.
					
					 Workers, farmers, poor people and youth and students are staging strong protests against the moves to pass the evil bills.
					
					 The attitude of the present chief executive who accused the "National Assembly" of delaying the carriage of the bills is reminiscent of the dictatorial action of the "yusin regime."
					
					 She should not forget a lesson of history taught by the end of the "yusin" dictatorship which utterly disregarded the NA and political parties.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty Supported by Syrian Ministry
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty Supported by Syrian Ministry
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Syrian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates made public a statement on Dec. 9 in support of the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Out of its principled stand valuing peace and security on the Korean Peninsula the government of the Syrian Arab Republic expresses support again for the just and fair proposal of the DPRK for settling the issue on the peninsula in a peaceful way and defusing the danger of war threatening regional and global peace and security on the principle of the UN Charter which calls for peace and security in all other countries.
					
					 Syria supports the proposal made by the DPRK to the U.S. for replacing the Armistice Agreement signed in 1953 with a peace treaty in order to achieve durable peace on the Korean Peninsula, build confidence, put an end to the war state and recover stability and security on the peninsula.
					
					 Syria wants to see the materialization of the Korean people's desire to achieve the reunification of the country without interference by outsiders in keeping with the line and principle of the leadership of the DPRK and the will of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Mexico, Thailand and India on Dec. 8 and 9 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise.
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea, Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and ushered in a new era of building a thriving socialist nation and firmly protected the sovereignty and dignity of the country with his Songun politics.
					
					 Chanai Longoen, chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association, said that Kim Jong Il provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, ushering in a new era of independent reunification, adding that this was the exploit specially recorded in the history of the Korean nation.
					
					 S. P. Pathak, chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that Kim Jong Il brought about a great heyday of prosperity unprecedented in the history of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Laud Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Laud Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Personages of France and Myanmar made public statements on November 27 and December 8 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Guy Dupre, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il dedicated his all to accomplishment of the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea.
					
					 He firmly defended the socialist cause and made tireless efforts to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, great leader and father of the people, will always be alive.
					
					 I pay high tribute to him.
					
					 Maung Maung Naying, general manager of the Mit Tamor Publishing House of Myanmar, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was the great man who turned the DPRK into an invincible politico-ideological power, military power and nuclear weapons state, holding high the banner of Songun.
					
					 He made long journeys for dedication to the people till the last moments of his life to lay a solid foundation for building a thriving nation.
					
					 His undying feats will always be remembered not only by the Korean people but by the world progressives.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Observe Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Observe Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups and articles on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The DR Congo paper L'Avenir on Dec. 8 carried a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il. It said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 He ushered in a new era of accomplishing the socialist cause with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 He consolidated the nation's capabilities for self-defence in every way to firmly defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and the nation.
					
					 His greatest exploit was that he provided a guarantee for the victory of the Songun revolution, shouldering upon himself the destiny of the country and the nation.
					
					 The Malaysian paper Guang Ming Daily on Dec. 3 carried his photo and introduced in detail the fact that the cause of perpetuating the memory of the leader has been achieved on the highest level in the DPRK.
					
					 The Dec. 8 issue of the Bangladeshi paper The Daily Folk said that he was the great politician who made a distinguished contribution to the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and the cause of global independence and benevolent father who valued the people so much and took warm care of them all his life.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Uruguay
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Uruguay
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The full text of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station Is a Proud and Grand Monument to Our Youth and a Symbol of Youth Power" was posted by a radio of Uruguay on its website on December 9.
					 A photo documenting his revolutionary activities was posted on the website.

articles.title: AA Should Be Replaced with Peace Treaty: Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
AA Should Be Replaced with Peace Treaty: Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website an article titled "Armistice Agreement should be replaced with peace treaty" on Dec. 3.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK clarified its fair and reasonable stance on replacing the AA with a peace treaty several times to defuse the danger of a war and tension and create a peaceful climate on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 However, the U.S. is still talking about the denuclearization and resumption of the six-party talks while insisting that an important advance should be made in denuclearization before replacing the AA with a peace treaty.
					
					 From a logical point of view, the U.S. assertion that if the DPRK unilaterally disarms itself first, peace will come can never convince anyone in the present situation in which the former persistently seeks its hostile policy towards the latter, threatening its existence and both of them are still technically at war. 
					
					 The DPRK's claim that if the peace treaty is concluded and the end of the U.S. hostile policy towards the former is confirmed, all problems such as the latter's concern can be settled is very justifiable.
					
					 The DPRK and the U.S., the responsible parties for the conclusion of the peace treaty, should discuss the issue of concluding the peace treaty without any precondition.

articles.title: CRPP revela culpabilidad de Sur de Corea de ruptura de conversaciones N-S
articles.content:
CRPP revela culpabilidad de Sur de Corea de ruptura de conversaciones N-S
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En la conferencia de prensa concedida el dia 12 en la zona industrial de Kaesong inmediatamente despues de la ruptura de la primera ronda de las conversaciones de autoridades Norte-Sur de Corea, el delegado jefe de la parte Sur dijo que ellos mismos presentaron varias propuestas y mostraron la sinceridad en el debate, pero la parte Norte puso obstaculos insistiendo en la solucion simultanea del problema de reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang y el de "familiares y parientes separados". 
					Los medios de prensa conservadores inducen en error la opinion publica como si la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tuviera la culpabilidad de la ruptura de la cita diciendo que "la parte Norte recurrio solo a la reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang".
					
					En una declaracion fechada 15, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria lo califica de grave e intolerable provocacion a la contraparte de dialogo y continua:
					
					Las conversaciones preparadas a duras penas en medio de la esperanza y atencion de toda la nacion quedaron infructiferas, lo cual es el resultado inevitable de la politica conflictiva de las autoridades surcoreanas que no desean el dialogo sincero ni la mejora de las relaciones con la parte connacional. 
					
					Francamente dicho, consideramos que no se resolveria nada en las conversaciones con las autoridades surcoreanas que siguen recurriendo a la confrontacion fratricida negando el acuerdo de agosto pasado. Pero, puesto que la parte Sur solicito reiteradamente que podria consultar todos los problemas en las conversaciones de autoridades, decidimos resolver primero los problemas urgentes y faciles en las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					En este contexto, dando enfasis en crear el ambiente de dialogo favorable a la mejora de las relaciones bilaterales, propusimos resolver el problema de reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang y el de familiares y parientes separados, temas mas apremiantes que atraen la atencion de todos los coreanos, y activar tambien el intercambio en varios dominios. 
					
					Sin embargo, la parte Sur infringio brutalmente el acuerdo logrado en el contacto de trabajo para las conversaciones de autoridades, ocasion en la cual ambas partes decidieron discutir y resolver los inmediatos problemas pendientes. Y pusieron obstaculos artificiales presentando los problemas inutiles a la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Dado que la parte Sur evita la discusion sobre la reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang, propusimos promover y ejecutar simultaneamente el reinicio del turismo y el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados. Entonces, la parte Sur nego discutir el primer tema "manteniendo el principio de no vincularlos".
					
					Persuadimos con magnanimidad a la parte Sur dilatando hasta el plazo de la cita. Sin embargo, la parte Sur llevo a la ruptura las conversaciones negando la reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang. 
					
					Ahora las autoridades surcoreanas, que impidieron todas las rutas preparadas en la era de reunificacion del 15 de junio y hasta el turismo al monte Kumgang, dicen que en la presente cita propusieron las "tres vias". Pues, ellas deben reflexionar por si solas si tienen la cara de hablar de la "via" 
					
					Las presentes conversaciones demostraron claramente que las relaciones intercoreanas no se pueden lograr ni un avance mientras las autoridades surcoreanas recurran a la dependencia de las fuerzas extranjeras y a la confrontacion fratricida y que no se resolvera nada aunque se realice el dialogo.

articles.title: Efectuado concierto de recordacion de jovenes y estudiantes
articles.content:
Efectuado concierto de recordacion de jovenes y estudiantes
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del IV aniversario del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tuvo lugar el dia 15 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el concierto de recordacion de los jovenes y estudiantes "Iremos siempre por nuestro camino".
					En la escena iniciada con la narracion y el coro "Ah, anhelo" se pusieron diversas piezas como la narracion y el quinteto femenino "Casa natal encubierta de nieve", la cancion con acompanamiento de guitarra "En el camino de lucha siguiendo al General", el solo de Janggo (instrumento musical folclorico coreano) "General corre a caballo blanco", etc.
					
					Los ejecutantes elogiaron la vida revolucionaria y proezas del Dirigente quien formo a los jovenes coreanos como protagonistas competentes para llevar a cabo exitosamente la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					El cuento y cancion de los miembros de Brigada de Choque Juventud Heroina del monte Paektu "Anoranza es mi felicidad" y otras piezas encomian al Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien continua con exito la tradicion victoriosa del autoctono movimiento de la juventud coreana realizada por los grandes lideres.
					
					El concierto de recordacion fue terminado con la poesia y coro "Iremos al monte Paektu", "Iremos siempre por nuestro camino" y "Kim Jong Il siempre esta vivo como el Sol" que reflejan la ferrea voluntad y conviccion de las vanguardias juveniles coreanas de avanzar por el camino de la revolucion enalteciendo al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il como Sol de Juche y apoyando con fidelidad la direccion del Mariscal.

articles.title: Espacio no es monopolio de EE.UU., subraya Minju Joson
articles.content:
Espacio no es monopolio de EE.UU., subraya Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Los "articulos de emulacion de lanzamiento al espacio de los cohetes comerciales", firmados el 25 de noviembre por el mandatario estadounidense Obama, estipulan que la NASA (Administracion Nacional de Aeronauta y del Espacio) y los Departamentos de Transporte y Defensa de la Administracion norteamericana tienen el derecho exclusivo a decidir cual cohete debe volarse al espacio, que debe o puede traer en el cosmos. Concretamente dicho, esto significa que cualquier pais debe recibir el permiso previo de Estados Unidos para explorar y desarrollar el cosmos.
					En un comentario individual divulgado el dia 15 el periodico Minju Joson critica que el hecho insinua que la arrogancia de EE.UU. supero su limite, de manera que se atreve a despreciar la ley y costumbre internacionales.
					
					El cosmos no es monopolio de alguien, sino lo comun de la humanidad y esto se garantiza por la ley internacional, asevera el rotativo y prosigue:
					
					EE.UU. se desespera para adoptar nueva ley nacional referente al desarrollo espacial, cuyo objetivo esencial es  intentar hacerse "policia espacial".
					
					El imperio norteamericano no abandona la ambicion egoista de monopolizar el espacio y estudiar la tecnologia espacial  para sacar solo su provecho.
					
					Por esta razon, en los ultimos anos EE.UU. cuestiona la exploracion espacial con fines pacificos de la RPDC como "desarrollo de cohetes" e instiga a sus satelites a dar una "presion internacional".
					
					El espacio no pertenecera a EE.UU. aunque este pais elabore la ley nacional.
					
					El cosmos no tiene la linea de demacracion y es para siempre lo comun de la humanidad.
					
					La RPDC ejercera dignamente el derecho al desarrollo del cosmos asumido ante si rechazando todas las provocaciones norteamericanas.
					
					EE.UU. debe abandonar el acto de violacion de soberania cuestionando el lanzamiento de satelites artificiales con fines pacificos de la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena resurreccion de militarismo en Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena resurreccion de militarismo en Japon
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el Partido Democratico Liberal de Japon, organizacion politica en el poder, organizo el comite de verificacion de la historia bajo el pretexto de comprobar la historia moderna y contemporanea de Japon. Dicen que esta organizacion, nacida con la pancarta "sede para aprender la historia y pensar el futuro", tratara la historia japonesa desde la guerra China-Japon de 1894 hasta la derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial y el problema posbelico.
					El comentario individual publicado el dia 15 en el diario Rodong Sinmun revela que a traves de esta organizacion Japon persigue el objetivo de poner al reves los verdaderos aspectos de la historia y justificar en lo academico los crimenes del pasado.
					
					Ahora, Japon da acicate a convertir su pais en potencia militar para vengarse de su derrota, senala el comentario y prosigue:
					
					Japon ya cuenta con la capacidad de producir las armas nucleares en cualquier momento y perfecciono hasta los medios de su transporte.
					
					Ademas, acelera la salida militar al cosmos.
					
					La nueva agresion de Japon depende del tiempo.
					
					Ya Japon completo todos los preparativos para el avance militar a ultramar.
					
					Pero, Japon debe saber la innegable ley de la historia de que el agresor no tiene la justicia y la injusticia se derrota sin falta.
					
					La repeticion de los crimenes del pasado significa el arruinamiento final.
					
					Para la existencia de Japon se queda el unico camino de eliminar completamente su anhelo a la nueva agresion.
